oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SE-ENRICHMENT OF CARROT AND ONION VIA FOLIAR APPLICATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kapolna, Emese
Laursen, Kristian H.
Hillestrøm, Peter
Husted, Søren
Larsen, Erik H.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farming Systems
Food systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The aim of this work was to study the selenium accumulation in carrot and onion plants using foliar application by sodium selenite and sodium selenate. Furthermore, we aimed at identifying the Se species biosynthesised by onion and carrot plants. The results were used to prepare for production of 77Se enriched plants for an ongoing human absorption study.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kapolna, Emese; Laursen, Kristian H.; Hillestrøm, Peter; Husted, Søren and Larsen, Erik H. (2008) SE-ENRICHMENT OF CARROT AND ONION VIA FOLIAR APPLICATION. Poster at: Nordic Conference on Plasma Spectrochemistry, Loen Norway, June 2008.
